com.binghamton.jhelp

Class ImportManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.binghamton.jhelp.ImportManager

  • public class ImportManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to manage imports in Java source programs. Lazily populates cache associating symbol names to Class reflection Objects. If a class is not found in the cache or by the ClassLoader, it is searched for in the on demand packages, of which java.lang is contained in.

    • Method Detail

      • addOnDemandPackage

        public boolean addOnDemandPackage(java.lang.String pkg)
        Attempt to add a package to the set of on demand packages
        Parameters:
        pkg - the name of the package whose imports are to be on demand
        Returns:
        true iff this package was not previously on demand, false otherwise

      • isOnDemand

        public boolean isOnDemand(java.lang.String pkg)
        Determines if a package name has been imported on demand
        Parameters:
        pkg - the name of the package to query
        Returns:
        true iff the package name has been imported on demand, false otherwise

      • isImported

        public boolean isImported(java.lang.String name)
        Determines if a symbol has been explicity imported
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the symbol to query
        Returns:
        true iff the symbol has been explicity imported, false otherwise

      • importSymbol

        public java.lang.Class<?> importSymbol(java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Attempts to import the corresponding named symbol. If the symbol is not cached, attempts to import the symbol, first explicitly, then in any on demand packages.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the symbol to import
        Returns:
        the Class Object reflecting the symbol found
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - iff no such symbol can be found
